post_text: Did they track the local tourist who went around JP? A bit OT, temperatures are much higher than normal now with sakura being forecasted 9 days early. Usually Tokyo is just single digits but was quite surprised yesterday 17-18 degrees.

thread: Coronavirus hotspots to avoid in Japan now
post_text: kifo wrote: Most dangerous of cos is Tokyo. I think fly in Osaka better, with only 1 official case currently. Safest places remaining are anywhere in Shikoku, Tohoku and the Sanin-Sanyo area. Safe travel everyone! osaka downtown and yuasa town where the hospital cluster occurred is about the same distance to kansai airport. the more populated areas of wakayama is alot closer to the airport compared to osaka downtown. other than masks and hand washing, the most important thing is to keep reminding oneself not to touch face no matter how itchy the eyes, nose or lips etc.

thread: Coronavirus hotspots to avoid in Japan now
post_text: hfngshnll wrote: osaka downtown and yuasa town where the hospital cluster occurred is about the same distance to kansai airport. the more populated areas of wakayama is alot closer to the airport compared to osaka downtown. other than masks and hand washing, the most important thing is to keep reminding oneself not to touch face no matter how itchy the eyes, nose or lips etc. most passengers who arrive at KIX jump on the train straight to namba/umeda/kyoto, unless you are going to wakayama, no chance to linger around
